reason: NOTATION AMBIGUITY: The notation |phi(a)|^2 could mean either |phi(a)|^2 (modulus squared of a complex number) or phi(a)*phi(a) if phi(a) is an element of some algebra. Given that phi maps into C (presumably), this should be clarified. Additionally, is phi(a*a) assumed to equal phi(a)*phi(a)? For a general positive linear functional, phi(ab) is not equal to phi(a)phi(b).
